Detailed Description

Transfer object for pointer coordinates.

Objects of this type can be used to manufacture new MotionEvent objects and to query pointer coordinate information in bulk.

Definition at line 19 of file MotionPointerCoords.h.

Creates a pointer coords object with all axes initialized to zero.

float  pressure,

float  touchMinor,
float  toolMajor,
float  toolMinor,
float  orientation 
)

Create a new pointer coords object, filling in all of the basic values that define the pointer coords object.

Parameters:
xThe X coordinate of the pointer movement.
yThe Y coordinate of the pointer movement.
pressureA scaled value that describes the pressure applied to the pointer.
sizeA scaled value of the approximate size of the pointer touch area.
touchMajorThe length of the major axis of an ellipse that describes the touch area at the point of contact.
touchMinorThe length of the minor axis of an ellipse that describes the touch area at the point of contact.
toolMinorThe length of the major axis of an ellipse that describes the size of the approaching tool.
orientationThe orientation of the touch area and tool area in radians clockwise from vertical.

Gets the value associated with the specified axis.

Parameters:
axisThe axis identifier for the axis value to retrieve.
Returns:
The value associated with the axis, or 0 if none.
See also:
MotionEvent::AXIS_X

float gaia::core::MotionPointerCoords::getOrientation ( ) const

Get the orientation of the touch area and tool area in radians clockwise from vertical.

An angle of 0 degrees indicates that the major axis of contact is oriented upwards, is perfectly circular or is of unknown orientation. A positive angle indicates that the major axis of contact is oriented to the right. A negative angle indicates that the major axis of contact is oriented to the left. The full range is from -PI/2 radians (finger pointing fully left) to PI/2 radians (finger pointing fully right).

float gaia::core::MotionPointerCoords::getPressure ( ) const

Get a scaled value that describes the pressure applied to the pointer.

The pressure generally ranges from 0 (no pressure at all) to 1 (normal pressure), however values higher than 1 may be generated depending on the calibration of the input device.

float gaia::core::MotionPointerCoords::getSize ( ) const

Get a scaled value of the approximate size of the pointer touch area.

This represents some approximation of the area of the screen being pressed; the actual value in pixels corresponding to the touch is normalized with the device specific range of values and scaled to a value between 0 and 1. The value of size can be used to determine fat touch events.

float gaia::core::MotionPointerCoords::getToolMajor ( ) const

Get the length of the major axis of an ellipse that describes the size of the approaching tool.

The tool area represents the estimated size of the finger or pen that is touching the device independent of its actual touch area at the point of contact. If the device is a touch screen, the length is reported in pixels, otherwise it is reported in device-specific units.

float gaia::core::MotionPointerCoords::getToolMinor ( ) const

Get the length of the major axis of an ellipse that describes the size of the approaching tool.

The tool area represents the estimated size of the finger or pen that is touching the device independent of its actual touch area at the point of contact.

float gaia::core::MotionPointerCoords::getTouchMajor ( ) const

Get the length of the major axis of an ellipse that describes the touch area at the point of contact.

float gaia::core::MotionPointerCoords::getTouchMinor ( ) const

Get the length of the minor axis of an ellipse that describes the touch area at the point of contact.

float gaia::core::MotionPointerCoords::getX ( ) const

Get the X coordinate of the pointer movement.

The interpretation varies by input source and may represent the position of the center of the contact area, a relative displacement in device-specific units or something else.

float gaia::core::MotionPointerCoords::getY ( ) const

Get the Y coordinate of the pointer movement.

The interpretation varies by input source and may represent the position of the center of the contact area, a relative displacement in device-specific units or something else.
